meanings.definition: A cowlstaffs is a type of staff used by monks.
meanings.sent1: The monk carried his cowlstaffs with reverence.
meanings.sent2: The cowlstaffs leaned against the wall in the monastery.
meanings.sent3: When the mischievous squirrel stole the cowlstaffs, the monk had to chase it around the garden.
meanings.sent4: The cowlstaffs stood tall like a guardian in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The intricate carvings on the cowlstaffs told stories of ancient times.

meanings.definition: Cowlstaffs can also refer to the hooded garment worn by monks.
meanings.sent1: The monk's cowlstaffs kept him warm during the chilly evening prayers.
meanings.sent2: She carefully folded the cowlstaffs after the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played hide-and-seek with the cowlstaffs, thinking it was a new friend.
meanings.sent4: The cowlstaffs draped over the monk like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the cowlstaffs brushed against his cheek as he bowed in prayer.
